import ResponsiveColumns from './ResponsiveColumns?dev-site-examples';
import ResponsiveColumnsMaxWidth from './ResponsiveColumnsMaxWidth?dev-site-examples';

# Responsive Columns

### Description

This example demonstrates a [Compact Interactive List](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about) component with responsive columns.

* The middle semantic column with the text information has the [flexGrow](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about#column) property set to **true**, which allows the column to expand to fill the container's width.
* The maximum width for the text column is unlimited because the [maximumWidth](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about#column) property is not set.
* The minimum width uses the default value because the [minimumWidth](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about#column) property is not set.
* Once the list reaches its minimum width, defined by the fixed width columns and the default minimum width of the flex expanding column, the scrollbar is displayed.

<ResponsiveColumns />

### Usage

#### Create a Responsive Column

Use one of the following methods to make a sematic column responsive:

* Omitt the [width](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about#column) property to make a semantic column expand or shrink to fill all available space.
* Set the [flexGrow](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about#column) property to **true** with the [width](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about#column) property set to a number that also makes the column responsive. 
  If you keep [width](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about#column), the property can be used as a [flex basis](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/flex-basis).

#### Control Maximum and Minimum Width

<Notice variant="important" ariaLevel="3">

The supported units for width properties are `px`, `em`, and `rem`. 
Ensure that the width units are consistent across all properties in the same component. The width properties are
[columnMinimumWidth](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about#compact-interactive-list-props-table), 
[columnMaximumWidth](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about#compact-interactive-list-props-table), 
[width](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about#column), 
[minimumWidth](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about#column), and 
[maximumWidth](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about#column).
Width units inconsistent with the rest of the component properties are disregarded.

</Notice>

* To control the minimum and maximum width of all flexible columns in the component, use the
  [columnMaximumWidth](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about#compact-interactive-list-props-table) and 
  [columnMinimumWidth](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about#compact-interactive-list-props-table) properties. 
  If the [columnMinimumWidth](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about#compact-interactive-list-props-table) property is not set, the default value is used.
* Alternatively, you can individually pass the [minimumWidth](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about#column) and [maximumWidth](/components/cerner-terra-framework-docs/compact-interactive-list/about#column) to a column, which provides more flexibility. 

In following example, the text column has the maximumWidth set to **400px** and minimumWidth set to **200px**:
